intro: Parnassia guilinensis, commonly known as the Guilin parnassia, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Parnassiaceae and is characterized by its white, bell-shaped flowers with a distinctive greenish-blue hue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and rocky slopes. Its leaves are usually oval-shaped with a smooth surface and a waxy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
